attributes.action: Dartford Crossing’s impact on the Bridge Estate
attributes.additional_details: Permit free access for the residents of the Bridge Estate via the alternative route.
attributes.background: Permit second access for residents of the Bridge Estate as the one access road is constantly blocked by traffic arising from the Dartford Crossing. It stops residents from accessing the estate for prolonged periods. Reasonable acces is requested via an available alternative route.

rejection.details:
Decisions relating to the building of local roads is a matter for the relevant local authority, in this case Kent County Council, not the UK Government or Parliament.

You could start a petition on the Kent County Council website which asks them to commission a second means of accessing the Bridge Estate, if that is something you'd like to see happen. You can find out how to do this here: https://democracy.kent.gov.uk/mgepetitionlistdisplay.aspx?bcr=1.

You could also raise your issue with a local councillor who represents you. You can use this page to find out who your local councillors are, and how to contact them:
https://www.gov.uk/find-your-local-councillors
